name: SSF5
title: Site-Specific Factor 5
subtitle: International Prognostic Score (IPS)
notes:
**Note 1:**  The International Prognostic Score (IPS) has been developed for Hodgkin lymphoma and predicts outcome based on the following adverse factors 

* Male sex
* Age 45 years or greater
* Ann Arbor Stage IV 
* Serum albumin less than 4 grams/deciliter (g/dl)
* Hemoglobin concentration less than 10.5 g/dl
* White blood cell count greater than or equal to 15,000/cubic millimeter (mm)
* Lymphocytopenia, lymphocyte count less than 600/cubic mm or less than 8% of white cell count

**Note 2:**  Record the IPS score as documented in the medical record.  Do not calculate points. Only record points if a physician has documented them.

**Note 3:**  There are now three indices/scores associated with lymphoma
* The International Prognostic Index (IPI) (**Site-Specific Factor 3**) 
* The Follicular Lymphoma International Prognostic Index (FLIPI) (**Site-Specific Factor 4**) 
* The International Prognostic Score (IPS- for Hodgkin lymphomas) (**Site-Specific Factor 5**)

Physicians may use these indices/scores interchangeably. For coding

* Score identified: Value in appropriate SSF, 999 in other two SSFs
* Score not identified, point value 5 or less: 999 in all three SSFs
* Score not identified, point value 6 or 7: Value in SSF 5 (IPS), 999 in other two SSFs
